isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 Cab - Glass, Frames and Mechanisms - Glass, Frames and Mechanisms Diagnosis and Testing

svcproc.title: Glass, Frames and Mechanisms Diagnosis and Testing

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Wiring Diagrams for schematic and connector information, and component testing.

svcsubproc.title: Principles of Operation
svcsubproc.para: The power window system operates under the control of the power window relay. The ignition switch will provide 12 volts to the relay coil, which actuates the relay and provides power to the power window system. The power window system can be operated from the driver window control switch or from the window control switch located on the passenger door panel. The driver window control switch has 2 modes of operation for the driver power window, manual and auto. The passenger window operates in the manual mode only.

Auto mode provides the one-touch down (OTD) feature for the driver front power window. The OTD function allows the driver front power window to be completely lowered when the driver window control switch is pressed to the 2nd detent position and then released. OTD is controlled internally by the driver window control switch.

step1.para: Verify the customer concern by operating the power window system.
Visually inspect for obvious signs of mechanical and electrical damage. Refer to the following chart:
If the concern remains after the inspection, GO to the Symptom Chart.

entry.para: The LH power window is inoperative
The RH power window is inoperative
The one-touch down (OTD) feature is inoperative
INSTALL a new LH window control switch. REFER to Window Control Switch in this section.

svcsubproc.title: Pinpoint Tests

para.emph: Pinpoint Test A: All Power Windows Are Inoperative

svcsubproc.para: The power window relay controls power to the LH and RH power windows. When the ignition is in the ON position, the power window relay coil, which is grounded through circuit 57 (BK), receives battery voltage through circuit 296 (WH/VT), which turns the relay ON. When the power window relay is active, it supplies 12 volts to the power window switches through circuit 170 (RD/LB).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST A: ALL POWER WINDOWS ARE INOPERATIVE

item.para: Measure the voltage between LH window control switch C504-5, circuit 170 (RD/LB), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?
A2 CHECK THE POWER WINDOW RELAY

item.para: Carry out the power window relay component test. Refer to the Wiring Diagrams for component testing.

para.emph: Did the relay pass the component test?

entry.para: INSTALL a new relay. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A3 CHECK THE POWER SUPPLY TO THE RELAY

item.para: Measure the voltage between power window relay socket pin 30, circuit 170 (RD/LB) and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: VERIFY the power distribution center (PDC) fuse 32 (40A) is OK. If OK, REPAIR circuit 170 (RD/LB) for an open. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A4 CHECK CIRCUIT 170 (RD/LB) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between power window relay socket pin 87, circuit 170 (RD/LB) and LH window control switch C504-5, circuit 170 (RD/LB) harness side.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Measure the voltage between power window relay socket pin 86, circuit 296 (WH/VT) and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A6 CHECK POWER WINDOW RELAY CIRCUIT 57 (BK)

item.para: Measure the resistance between power window relay socket pin 85, circuit 57 (BK) harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: The concern may have been caused by loose or corroded pins or a damaged connector. CHECK the power window relay sockets and power window switch C504 for corroded or pushed out pins and repair any obvious concerns. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A7 CHECK CIRCUIT 57 (BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between LH window control switch C504-3, circuit 57 (BK).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new LH window control switch. REFER to Window Control Switch in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test B: The LH Power Window Is Inoperative

svcsubproc.para: The LH window control switch receives battery voltage from the power window relay through circuit 170 (RD/LB) and ground through circuit 57 (BK). When the LH window control switch is pressed to the DOWN position, battery voltage is sent to the LH window motor through circuit 227 (YE) and ground through circuit 226 (WH/BK), and the window will move downward. When the LH window control switch is pressed to the UP position, battery voltage is sent to the LH window motor through circuit 226 (WH/BK) and ground through circuit 227 (YE).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST B: THE LH POWER WINDOW IS INOPERATIVE

para.emph: B1 CHECK THE LH POWER WINDOW MOTOR

item.para: Disconnect: LH Window Control Switch C504

Connect a fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C504-5, circuit 170 (RD/LB) harness side, and C504-4, circuit 227 (YE). Connect a second fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C504-3, circuit 57 (BK) and C504-1, circuit 226 (WH/BK). The window should operate in the UP direction.

Connect a fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C504-5, circuit 170 (RD/LB) harness side, and C504-1, circuit 226 (WH/BK) harness side. Connect a second fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C504-3, circuit 57 (BK) and C504-4, circuit 227 (YE). The window should operate in the DOWN direction.

para.emph: Did the LH window operate correctly?

entry.para: INSTALL a new LH window control switch. REFER to Window Control Switch in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B2 CHECK CIRCUIT 226 (WH/BK) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between LH window control switch C504-1, circuit 226 (WH/BK) harness side and LH window motor C518-1, circuit 226 (WH/BK) harness side.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B3 CHECK CIRCUIT 227 (YE) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between LH window control switch C504-4, circuit 227 (YE) harness side and LH window motor C518-2, circuit 227 (YE) harness side.

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new LH window regulator and motor. REFER to Door Window Regulator and Motor in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test C: The RH Power Window Is Inoperative

svcsubproc.para: The RH front window control switch receives battery voltage through circuit 170 (RD/LB) when the power window relay is active. When the RH front window control switch is pressed to the DOWN position, the RH front window control switch receives ground from the LH front window switch through circuit 226 (WH/BK). When operating the RH front window in the DOWN direction, the RH front window control switch supplies power to the RH front window motor through circuit 226 (WH/BK) and ground through circuit 227 (YE).

When the RH front window control switch is pressed to the UP position, the RH front window control switch receives ground from the LH front window switch through circuit 227 (YE). When operating the RH front window in the UP direction, the RH front window control switch provides power to the RH front window motor through circuit 227 (YE) and ground through circuit 226 (WH/BK).

para.emph: RH Window Operation From LH Switch

svcsubproc.para: When the RH power window is operated in the DOWN direction from the LH window control switch, power is sent to the RH window control switch through circuit 226 (WH/BK), which transfers power to the RH front window motor through circuit 227 (YE). Ground is provided to the RH window switch through circuit 227 (YE), which transfers ground to the RH front window motor through circuit 226 (WH/BK).

When the RH power window is operated in the UP direction from the LH window control switch, power is sent to the RH window control switch through circuit 227 (YE), which transfers power to the front window motor through circuit 226 (WH/BK). Ground is provided to the RH window switch through circuit 226 (WH/BK), which transfers ground to the RH front window motor through circuit 227 (YE).

table.title: PINPOINT TEST C: THE RH POWER WINDOW IS INOPERATIVE

item.para: Measure the voltage between RH window control switch C604-6, circuit 170 (RD/LB), harness side and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C2 CHECK THE RH POWER WINDOW MOTOR

item.para: Connect a fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C604-6, circuit 170 (RD/LB) harness side, and C604-2, circuit 226 (WH/BK). Connect a second fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C604-5, circuit 226 (WH/BK), and C604-3, circuit 227 (YE). The window should operate in the UP direction.

Connect a fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C604-6, circuit 170 (RD/LB) harness side, and C604-3, circuit 227 (YE) harness side. Connect a second fused jumper wire between LH window control switch C604-1, circuit 227 (YE) and C604-2, circuit 226 (WH/BK). The window should operate in the DOWN direction.

para.emph: Did the RH window operate correctly?

entry.para: INSTALL a new RH window control switch. REFER to Window Control Switch in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C3 CHECK THE LH WINDOW CONTROL SWITCH

item.para: Carry out the LH window control switch component test. Refer to the Wiring Diagrams for component testing.

para.emph: Did the LH window control switch pass the component test?

entry.para: INSTALL a new RH window control switch. REFER to Window Control Switch in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C4 CHECK THE LH WINDOW CONTROL SWITCH

item.para: Carry out the LH window control switch component test. Refer to the Wiring Diagrams for component testing.

para.emph: Did the LH window control switch pass the component test?

entry.para: INSTALL a new LH window control switch. REFER to Window Control Switch in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C5 CHECK THE RH FRONT WINDOW CONTROL SWITCH

item.para: Carry out the RH window control switch component test. Refer to the Wiring Diagrams for component testing.

para.emph: Did the RH window control switch pass the component test?

entry.para: INSTALL a new RH window control switch. REFER to Window Control Switch in this section. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C6 CHECK LH WINDOW SWITCH CIRCUITS 226 (WH/BK) AND 227 (YE) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between LH window control switch C504-2, circuit 227 (YE) harness side and RH window control switch C604-1, circuit 227 (YE) harness side.
Measure the resistance between LH window control switch C504-6, circuit 226 (WH/BK) harness side and RH window control switch C604-5, circuit 227 (YE) harness side.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C7 CHECK RH WINDOW SWITCH CIRCUITS 226 (WH/BK) AND 227 (YE) FOR AN OPEN

item.para: Measure the resistance between RH window control switch C604-3, circuit 227 (YE) harness side and RH window control switch C623-1, circuit 227 (YE) harness side.
Measure the resistance between RH window control switch C604-2, circuit 226 (WH/BK) harness side and RH window control switch C623-2, circuit 226 (WH/BK) harness side.

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: INSTALL a new RH window regulator and motor. REFER to Door Window Regulator and Motor. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.
